author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here on Friday dismissed a public interest litigation petition challenging a notification issued by the Centre in 2011 to include bulls under a list of animals prohibited from being used for public performances.

Case rejected

The First Division Bench comprising Chief Justice Sanjay Kishan Kaul and Justice V. Ramasubramanian rejected the case after Assistant Solicitor General G.R. Swaminathan pointed out that the validity of the notification had been upheld by the Supreme Court in 2014.

'Abuse of process of court'

Placing the judgment passed by the apex court in a batch of cases related to ban on jallikattu, the ASG said: “Where is the question of challenging a notification in the High Court after it has been upheld by the Supreme Court. This is abuse of process of court.”

'No valid ground to entertain case'

Accepting his submissions and after recording relevant paragraphs from the apex court judgment, the Division Bench said that it did not find any valid ground to entertain the case.
title: HC dismisses case against 2011 notification banning use of bulls as performing animals
